thread.title: Kenya: Tutors Urged to Stay Away From Schools
thread.title_full: Kenya: Tutors Urged to Stay Away From Schools

title: Kenya: Tutors Urged to Stay Away From Schools
text:
Africa: Sharing Picture Books Can Make Children Smarter, More Attentive By John Kisu 
Teachers in Mukaa and Nzaui subcounties have been told to continue the strike until the government pays them. 
The Knut branch secretary Onesmus Ndivo told the teachers not to be scared by TSC's sacking threat. 
Speaking at his Matiliku office yesterday, Ndivo told President Uhuru Kenyatta to obey the judgment of the Supreme Court and pay the teachers their 50-60 per cent pay rise. 
He told teachers to keep away from schools and told the parents to stay home with their children. Kenya
